brief_summary.textblock:
To evaluate the clinical benefit of spectrum analysis of endobronchial ultrasound images of
      lymph nodes during EBUS TBNA for lymph node staging in patients with lung cancer.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Ages 18 years or older

          -  Patients with known or suspected lung cancer who require EBUS-TBNA for lymph node
             staging

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients who are deemed on clinical grounds not to be medically fit for a
             bronchoscopy

          -  Inability to give informed consent

          -  Patients who are pregnant

study_pop.textblock:
Patients with lung cancer or suspected lung cancer who undergo EBUS TBNA for lymph node
        staging.

intervention.intervention_name: Spectrum Image Analysis using a Linear Array Ultrasound Bronchoscope

clinical_study.official_title: Spectrum Image Analysis of Lymph Nodes During Endobronchial Ultrasound-Guided (EBUS) Transbronchial Needle Aspiration (TBNA) in Patients With Lung Cancer

primary_outcome.description: The lymph node staging will be determined by the pathology report of the biopsy taken from the patients lymph node(s).
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pathology report will be completed as soon as possible after the procedure. (Within one year)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
